text: The Wright Solar is a single-decker body of a bus. It has a low-floor. It was made from 2000 to 2011 by Wrightbus. The Wright Solar body was built on the Scania L94UB chassis and the Scania K UB chassis. == Operators == In 2006, Translink ordered 198 Wright Solars, From 2000 to 2011, Go North East ordered 80 Wright Solars. From 2003 to 2005, Trentbarton ordered 92 Wright Solars.Wright Solar Bus Lists on the Web == Solar Rural == In 2008, Wrightbus made a new bus body called the Solar Rural. It was made for Ulsterbus who wanted a bus to use for rural bus services across Northern Ireland. The Solar Rural had three seats on one side of the bus and had narrower front passenger doors. The Wright Solar Rural body was built for the Scania K-series chassis. ==References== ==Other websites== Category:Low-floor buses Solar
title: Wright Solar
